abstract: Merrill Lynch, now owned by Bank of America, agreed to pay $75 million to settle a class-action lawsuit by employees who lost money investing in Merrill stock through their retirement plans, Reuters said.
lead_paragraph: Merrill Lynch, now owned by Bank of America, agreed to pay $75 million to settle a class-action lawsuit by employees who lost money investing in Merrill stock through their retirement plans, Reuters said.

headline.main: Merrill Settles Employee Suit For $75 Million

abstract: Congressman Dennis Kucinich on Monday asked the Securities and Exchange Commission to determine if Bank of America violated federal securities laws by not disclosing Merrill Lynch‘s plan to pay $3.62 billion of bonuses to top executives, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Congressman Dennis Kucinich on Monday asked the Securities and Exchange Commission to determine if Bank of America violated federal securities laws by not disclosing Merrill Lynch‘s plan to pay $3.62 billion of bonuses to top executives, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Kucinich Asks If Merrill Bonuses Broke Laws
